author: Special Correspondent
text:
B. Alagesan, Additional Director, Industrial Safety and Health, Tiruchi Zone, giving away prize to a winner in a competition on safety week celebration at Dalmiapuram near Tiruchi on Friday. He is flanked by R.A. Krishnakumar,left, Executive Director, Dalmia Cement (left), and A. Ravi (right), Joint Director, Industrial Safety and Health.

A week-long annual National Safety week celebrations was held under the auspices of Dalmia Cement Bharat Limited at Dalmiapuram near here recently.

B. Alagesan, Additional Director, Industrial Safety and Health, Tiruchi Zone, emphasized the need to practise safety not only at industrial and production zones but even at domestic activities. “Safety should be the ‘mantra’ for each and every individual for ensuring peace and happiness,” he said.

He said that road safety too has become all the more important in the present-day context. A. Ravi, Joint Director, Industrial Safety and Health, in his address, underlined the need to adhere to safety norms.

R.A. Krishnakumar, Executive Director, Dalmia Cement, spoke on the special safety strategy the company has taken up as a regular project. “Safety can not comprised on any account,” he said. A systematic training programme on safety was being imparted to the employees. He said that banners and flex boards advising the parents not to allow their awards below the age of 18 years to ride two-wheelers, have been set up at Dalmiapuram quarters, as part of safety measures.

As part of Safety Week celebration, several competitions like essay, elocution, drawing, slogan and quiz were conducted for employees and their family members and school pupils.

Earlier, Mr. Alagesan gave away the prizes to winners in the competition.
title: Safety becomes buzzword on Dalmia Cement premises
